project.name: GIScene 3D WebGIS API.
project.description: GIScene 3D WebGIS API: a library based on THREE.js for visualization and analysis of geographic 3D content. It's easy to learn and customize.

GIScene.name: GIScene
GIScene.description:
Base Object wich gives the namespace for all other classes of the library.
Defines global constants used in other classes

GIScene.Control.AxisHelper.name: GIScene.Control.AxisHelper
GIScene.Control.AxisHelper.description: The AxisHelper Control provides a graphical information on the current camera orientation in 3D space.

params.name: config
params.description: you can configure the size with an config object {size:50}

GIScene.Control.CameraLight.name: GIScene.Control.CameraLight
GIScene.Control.CameraLight.description:
A control which adds a sprite to the viewport for interactive movement of a directional light source.
The Light will always stay relative to the camera. This ensures to keep a chosen lighting angle while moving the camera.
Changing interactively the lighting angle gives the user a good impression of surface characteristics.

params.name: config
params.description: config.<properties> are: maxHorizontalAngle, maxVerticalAngle both Numbers in degrees between 0..90

GIScene.Control.Compass.name: GIScene.Control.Compass
GIScene.Control.Compass.description: The Compass Control provides a graphical information on the current camera orientation, like a compass.

GIScene.Control.EdgeDetectionFreiChen.name: GIScene.Control.EdgeDetectionFreiChen
GIScene.Control.EdgeDetectionFreiChen.description: Edge Detection Control to render scenes with FreiChen Filter

GIScene.Control.Fly.name: GIScene.Control.Fly
GIScene.Control.Fly.description: Control to Fly over through a scene.

params.name: object
params.description: The camera object to be used with this control

params.name: domElement
params.description: The DOM Element to which the mouse events will be added

GIScene.Control.Fly.author: modified by m.auer

GIScene.Control.LoadIndicator.name: GIScene.Control.LoadIndicator
GIScene.Control.LoadIndicator.description: The LoadIndicator-Control provides visual feedback about the current state of loading activity.

GIScene.Control.Measure.name: GIScene.Control.Measure

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration properties. e.g. {color : new THREE.Color(0xff0000)}

GIScene.Control.ObjectPosition.name: GIScene.Control.ObjectPosition
GIScene.Control.ObjectPosition.description: This Control diplays the Object position coordinates in a TextPanel

GIScene.Control.OrbitZoomPan.name: GIScene.Control.OrbitZoomPan
GIScene.Control.OrbitZoomPan.description: Control to Examine Objects. Rotates the Camera around a center, zooms in and out and pans the camera.

params.name: object
params.description: The camera object to be used with this control

params.name: domElement
params.description: The DOM Element to which the mouse events will be added

GIScene.Control.OrbitZoomPan.author:
alteredq / http://alteredqualia.com/
modified by m.auer

GIScene.Control.Pan.name: GIScene.Control.Pan
GIScene.Control.Pan.description: Pan Control. *experimental, not ready to use*

params.name: object
params.description: The camera object to be used with this control

params.name: domElement
params.description: The DOM Element to which the mouse events will be added

GIScene.Control.PanOrbitZoomCenter.name: GIScene.Control.PanOrbitZoomCenter
GIScene.Control.PanOrbitZoomCenter.description: Control to examine Objects and move around on a terrain. Rotates the Camera around a center, zooms in and out, pans the camera and moves to a new rotation center on double click.

params.name: object
params.description: The camera object to be used with this control

params.name: domElement
params.description: The DOM Element to which the mouse events will be added

GIScene.Control.PanOrbitZoomCenter.author:
alteredq / http://alteredqualia.com/
modified by m.auer

GIScene.Control.Pick.name: GIScene.Control.Pick

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration properties. e.g. {color : new THREE.Color(0xff0000)}

GIScene.Control.SSAO.name: GIScene.Control.SSAO
GIScene.Control.SSAO.description: This Control enables to render a Scene with a Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) effect.

GIScene.Control.Select.name: GIScene.Control.Select
GIScene.Control.Select.description: Control to enable the interactive selection and or highlighting of 3D Objects in the scene

params.name: selectables
params.description: An Array or single THREE.Object3D. Contains the potentially selectable Elements of type THREE.Object3D

params.name: camera
params.description: The active camera

params.name: config
params.description:
Configuration properties to influence the behaviour of this Control
	

 You can use multiple options to customize the behaviour of the Select Control:
	
	Main options: 

	1. Choose between hover or click behaviour by setting hover:true || hover:false
 2. Choose whether objects should be really selected or just highlighted by setting highlightOnly:true || highlightOnly:false
 3. Choose a highlighting color by setting e.g: selectColor:0xff0000

 The following options are only available if hover:false:

 multi    - whether it is possible to select only one object or multiple (hold down CTRL-Key)

 toggle   - whether click on a selected/highlighted object unselects/unhighlights it again

 clickout - whether a click somewhere not on a selectable object unselects all others 
	
 You can even combine 2 Select controls to enable highlighting on mouseover ('hover') and selection on click:

GIScene.Control.TextPanel.name: GIScene.Control.TextPanel
GIScene.Control.TextPanel.description: The Compass Control provides a panel on which you can add text.

params.name: config] object properties may be: width, height, text:['Line1','Line2'
params.description: , textAlign:'left|start|center|end|right', pxFromLeft, pxFromTop, fontSize, lineSpace, fontFamily, fontStyle, color, halo

GIScene.Control.Trackball.name: GIScene.Control.Trackball
GIScene.Control.Trackball.description: Control to freely move the camera around a target point. Rotates, zooms, pans.

params.name: object
params.description: The camera object to be used with this control

params.name: domElement
params.description: The DOM Element to which the mouse events will be added

GIScene.Control.Trackball.author:
Eberhard Graether / http://egraether.com/
modified by m.auer

GIScene.Control.Walk.name: GIScene.Control.Walk
GIScene.Control.Walk.description: Control to simulate walking. Use keybord controls.

params.name: object
params.description: The camera object to be used with this control

params.name: domElement
params.description: The DOM Element to which the mouse events will be added

GIScene.Control.Walk.author: modified by m.auer

GIScene.Layer.W3DS_0_4_0.name: GIScene.Layer.W3DS_0_4_0
GIScene.Layer.W3DS_0_4_0.description:
Tiled multi LOD grid layer using the W3DS v0.4.0 OGC Discussion Paper Specification to load georeferenced 3D data
inherits from GIScene.Layer.Grid

params.name: name
params.description: the layer name

params.name: config
params.description: a configuration object

GIScene.Layer.W3DS_0_4_1.name: GIScene.Layer.W3DS_0_4_1
GIScene.Layer.W3DS_0_4_1.description:
Tiled multi LOD grid layer using the W3DS v0.4.1 OGC Discussion Paper Specification to load georeferenced 3D data
inherits from GIScene.Layer.Grid

params.name: name
params.description: the layer name

params.name: config
params.description: a configuration object

GIScene.Layer.Fixed.name: GIScene.Layer.Fixed
GIScene.Layer.Fixed.description: It doesn't care about BoundingBoxes, Frustums, LODs or geographic grids.

params.name: name
params.description: the layer name for display purposes

params.name: config
params.description: the layer configuration object

params.name: name
params.description: the layer name for display purposes

params.name: config
params.description: the layer configuration object

GIScene.Layer.Helper.name: GIScene.Layer.Helper
GIScene.Layer.Helper.description:
A Helper Layer has a property isTangible = false.
This helps to determine objects which shouldn't be reflected in ray intersections, e.g. during visibility analysis.

params.name: name
params.description: the layer name for display purposes

params.name: config
params.description: the layer configuration object

GIScene.GeoJSONLoader.name: GIScene.GeoJSONLoader
GIScene.GeoJSONLoader.description:
Loads a geojson file. Provides Methods to load and parse GeoJSON Files/Objects

 Currently no reprojection is supported, geojson-coords have to be in sceneunits.
 TODO offset support
GIScene.GeoJSONLoader.author: m.auer

GIScene.LocalFileLoader.name: GIScene.LocalFileLoader
GIScene.LocalFileLoader.description: The local file loader will load files from the local file system

params.name: fileInputElement
params.description: an input element of type="file" used to choose the file to load

params.name: readAs
params.description: defines the nature of the result. Can be "text", "dataURL", "binaryString" or "arrayBuffer"

params.name: onSuccess
params.description: will have an argument containing the fileReader.result, which depends on the readAs property

params.name: onProgress
params.description: will have an argument containing the ProgressEvent

params.name: onError
params.description: will have an argument containing the DOMError object of fileReader.error

GIScene.OverrideMaterialHandler.WMS.name: GIScene.OverrideMaterialHandler.WMS
GIScene.OverrideMaterialHandler.WMS.description:
OverrideMaterialHandler to assign WMS images to objects, like terrain tiles.
Works only with GIScene.RasterOverlayMaterial

GIScene.Process.Intervisibility.name: GIScene.Process.Intervisibility
GIScene.Process.Intervisibility.description:
The Intervisibility Process calculates the intervisibility between two points in the scene. 
It takes different observer offset and target offset heights into account.
GIScene.Process.Intervisibility.author: mcauer https://github.com/mcauer

GIScene.Process.LineOfSight.name: GIScene.Process.LineOfSight
GIScene.Process.LineOfSight.description: The Line of Sight Process calculates the visibility bewtween two points in the scene. Only for static/fixed layers.
GIScene.Process.LineOfSight.author: mcauer https://github.com/mcauer

GIScene.Process.LineOfSightNetwork_allTo.name: GIScene.Process.LineOfSightNetwork_allToAll
GIScene.Process.LineOfSightNetwork_allTo.description: The Line of Sight Network (all to all) Process calculates the intervisibility between all points in the given dataset (point layer)
GIScene.Process.LineOfSightNetwork_allTo.author: mcauer https://github.com/mcauer

GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_Layer.name: GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_Layer
GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_Layer.description:
The Line of Sight Process calculates the visibility between two points in the scene. 
Obstacles can be specified as layers.
Inputs can be specified as layers.

GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_fastClient.name: GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_fastClient
GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_fastClient.description: The Line of Sight Process calculates the visibility bewtween two points in the scene

GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_simpleClient.name: GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_simpleClient
GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_simpleClient.description: The Line of Sight Process calculates the visibility bewtween two points in the scene
GIScene.Process.LineOfSight_simpleClient.author: mcauer https://github.com/mcauer

GIScene.Service.W3DS_0_4_0.name: GIScene.Service.W3DS_0_4_0
GIScene.Service.W3DS_0_4_0.description: Service Interface to load data from a W3DS OGC Discussion Paper Specification Implementation

params.name: config
params.description: a config object for this class

params.name: params
params.description: an object to specify service parameters, e.g. layer, crs, offset

GIScene.Service.W3DS_0_4_1.name: GIScene.Service.W3DS_0_4_1
GIScene.Service.W3DS_0_4_1.description: Service Interface to load data from a W3DS OGC Discussion Paper Specification Implementation

params.name: config
params.description: a config object for this class

params.name: params
params.description: an object to specify service parameters, e.g. layer, crs, offset

GIScene.AspectMaterial.name: GIScene.AspectMaterial
GIScene.AspectMaterial.description:
Visualizes a specified compass direction (aspect) by color coding faces which are perpendicular to that direction within a specified deviation.
This is similar to the DirectionMaterial but only considers the horizontal angle of the face normals and not the vertical angle.

params.name: maxDeviationDeg
params.description: A Number specifying the maximum deviation from compassDirection to which the colorramp is streched

GIScene.DirectionMaterial.name: GIScene.DirectionMaterial
GIScene.DirectionMaterial.description: Visualizes a specified direction by color coding faces which are perpendicular to that direction within a specified deviation.

params.name: maxDeviationDeg
params.description: A Number specifying the maximum deviation from direction to which the colorramp is streched

GIScene.DistanceOpacityMaterial.name: GIScene.DistanceOpacityMaterial
GIScene.DistanceOpacityMaterial.description:
A Material which sets opacity according to the distance to the camera. 
Close parts will be transparent, so you could watch inside a building, while the walls in the back are still opaque.

params.name: near
params.description: distance from where opacity begins

params.name: far
params.description: distance from where opacity will be 1.0

GIScene.PointAlignmentMaterial.name: GIScene.PointAlignmentMaterial
GIScene.PointAlignmentMaterial.description: The PointAlignmentMaterial highlights fragments whose normals are heading to a given point.

GIScene.RasterOverlayMaterial.name: GIScene.RasterOverlayMaterial
GIScene.RasterOverlayMaterial.description: This Material renders a georeferenced texture on a mesh without using textureCoordinates, but realWorldCoordinates of each fragment(pixel).

params.name: config
params.description: an Object with config properties

GIScene.WMSOverlayMaterial.name: GIScene.WMSOverlayMaterial
GIScene.WMSOverlayMaterial.description: special raster overlay material to use OGC-WMS services as image source

params.name: config
params.description: the config object for the material

params.name: params
params.description: the OGC-WMS params for the request string

GIScene.Control.name: GIScene.Control
GIScene.Control.description: Abstract class used for Control classes

GIscene.Coordinate2.name: GIscene.Coordinate2
GIscene.Coordinate2.description: GIScene.Coordinate2 represents a 2 dimensional coordinate like in geographic or geodesic coordinate reference systems.

params.name: x
params.description: east-west direction

params.name: y
params.description: south-north direction

GIscene.Coordinate3.name: GIscene.Coordinate3
GIscene.Coordinate3.description: GIScene.Coordinate3 represents a 3 dimensional coordinate in a right-handed system with z(height) upwards, like in geographic or geodesic coordinate reference systems.

params.name: x
params.description: east-west direction

params.name: y
params.description: south-north direction

params.name: z
params.description: height

GIScene.Extent2.name: GIScene.Extent2
GIScene.Extent2.description: Represents a 2D bounding box in geo coordinates (z = height)

params.name: minCoordinate2
params.description: the lower left corner coordinate

params.name: maxCoordinate2
params.description: the upper right corner coordinate

GIScene.Format.name: GIScene.Format
GIScene.Format.description: File Format Constants to be used with loaders

GIScene.Grid.name: GIScene.Grid
GIScene.Grid.description: A Grid is defined by an origin and a tile size and provides functions to get indices, boundingBoxes etc.

GIScene.Grid.Index.name: GIScene.Grid.Index
GIScene.Grid.Index.description:
An object representing a tile in the grid.
The x property indexes the tiles from west to east.
The y property indexes the tiles from south to north.

GIScene.Layer.name: GIScene.Layer
GIScene.Layer.description: Base class used for Layer classes

params.name: name
params.description: the layer name for display purposes

params.name: config
params.description: the layer configuration object

GIScene.Layer.author: mcauer https://github.com/mcauer

GIScene.ModelLoader.name: GIScene.ModelLoader
GIScene.ModelLoader.description: Loader class to load different formats

GIScene.OverrideMaterialHandler.name: GIScene.OverrideMaterialHandler
GIScene.OverrideMaterialHandler.description:
Abstract base class to implement override material handler. 
These are functions that will be called on each object just after the override Material will be assigned to each object by using the Layer-event "afterOverrideMaterial"
These handlers should be referenced in the overrideMaterialHandler property of the Layer

params.name: containerDivId
params.description: The id of an HTMLDivElement which will be used as container for the webgl canvas.

params.name: config

GIScene.Style.name: GIScene.Style
GIScene.Style.description: This class describes a style object with a name, title, material and definitions on which objects of a layer the style should be applied

GIScene.Utils.name: GIScene.Utils
GIScene.Utils.description: Utility Class with convenience functions stored in a central place.

classitems.description: Used for Raycaster when selecting on a THREE.Points object
classitems.name: clickPointThreshold

classitems.description: Highlight an object. This will also be called by the select() function. Sets object.userData.isHighlighted = true.
classitems.name: highlight

params.name: interaction
params.description: this flag is used to differentiate between user interaction triggered selection or programmatical selection resulting in a special event for user-triggerd selections.

classitems.description:
The highlighted event will be triggered after the feature is highlighted.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the highlighted object.
classitems.name: highlighted

classitems.description:
The highlightedbyuser event will be triggered after the feature is highlighted by a user interaction.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the highlighted object.
classitems.name: highlightedbyuser

classitems.description: Unhighlight an object. This will also be called by the unselect() function. Sets object.userData.isHighlighted = false.
classitems.name: unhighlight

params.name: interaction
params.description: this flag is used to differentiate between user interaction triggered selection or programmatical selection resulting in a special event for user-triggerd selections.

classitems.description:
The unhighlighted event will be triggered after the feature is unhighlighted.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the unhighlighted object.
classitems.name: unhighlighted

classitems.description:
The unhighlightedbyuser event will be triggered after the feature is unhighlighted through user interaction.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the unhighlighted object.
classitems.name: unhighlightedbyuser

classitems.description: Select an object. This will also call the highlight() function. Sets object.userData.isSelected = true.
classitems.name: select

params.name: interaction
params.description: this flag is used to differentiate between user interaction triggered selection or programmatical selection resulting in a special event for user-triggerd selections.

classitems.description:
The selected event will be triggered before the feature is highlighted.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the selected object.
classitems.name: selected

classitems.description:
The selectedbyuser event will be triggered before the feature is highlighted.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the selected object.
classitems.name: selectedbyuser

classitems.description: Unselect an object. This will also call the unhighlight() function. Sets object.userData.isSelected = false.
classitems.name: unselect

params.name: interaction
params.description: this flag is used to differentiate between user interaction triggered selection or programmatical selection resulting in a special event for user-triggerd selections.

classitems.description:
The unselected event will be triggered after the feature is unhighlighted.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the unselected object.
classitems.name: unselected

classitems.description:
The unselectedbyuser event will be triggered after the feature is unhighlighted.
The event contains a content property with a reference to the unselected object.

classitems.description:
Fires after layer is loaded. 
event.content holds a reference to the layer
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: Starts the automatic loading and removing of tiles dependant on the camera perspective
classitems.name: startUpdate

classitems.description: Stops the automatic loading and removing of tiles dependent on the camera perspective
classitems.name: stopUpdate

classitems.description: Loads a tile by specifiying a GIScene.Grid.Index
classitems.name: loadTile

classitems.description: Fires after a tile is added to the scene. A reference to the tile can be found at event.content.tile
classitems.name: tileadd

classitems.description: Fires after a tile is loaded. A reference to the tile can be found at event.content.tile
classitems.name: tileload

classitems.description: loads several tiles by specifying an array of GIScene.Grid.Index objects
classitems.name: loadTiles

classitems.description: Removes a tile or aborts its loading by specifiying a GIScene.Grid.Index
classitems.name: removeTile

classitems.description: Fires after a tile is removed from the scene. A reference to the tile can be found at event.content.tile
classitems.name: tileremove

classitems.description: removes or aborts the loading of several tiles by specifying an array of GIScene.Grid.Index objects
classitems.name: removeTiles

classitems.description: computes the visible tiles of the current camera view
classitems.name: getNewTilesFromQuadtree

classitems.description: updates the current tiles, loads new tiles and removes old ones

classitems.description: set an approximate terrain height at which the view frustrum will be cut horizontally to determine the visible tiles to be loaded
classitems.name: setTerrainHeight

params.name: height
params.description: the terrain height in coordinate reference system (CRS) units (e.g. meters)

classitems.name: setMaxExtent

params.name: maxExtent2
params.description: a 2D bounding box in coordinate reference system (CRS) units

classitems.description: switches the visibility of the layer on or off
classitems.name: setVisibility

run the process with the inputs that have been set before

classitems.description: The default config which is used when no config object is provided.

classitems.description: Jump to another place in the scene.
classitems.name: setCenter

params.name: vector
params.description: vector in scene coordinates

params.name: positionFromCenter
params.description: vector to place the camera at some distance from the point of interest (vector)

params.name: duration
params.description: duration in milliseconds. if undefined or > 0 an animation is perforemed from the current to the specified new center. Set this to 0 to jump immediately to the new location.

classitems.description: Fires after setCenter() completed
classitems.name: center

classitems.description: Fires after setCenter() completed
classitems.name: center

classitems.description: Function to move camera to predefined relative positions from Scene.center

params.name: relativePosition
params.description: allowed values are 'left','right','front','back','top','bottom'

classitems.description: Removes a layer from the scene

classitems.description: Set the wireframe property for the whole scene

params.name: wireframeMode

params.name: texturingMode
params.description: can be: {String} 'default' | {boolean} true | {boolean} false

classitems.name: setFaceCulling

classitems.description: Sets the vertex color mode for the whole scene

classitems.description: Sets the shading mode for the whole scene
classitems.name: setShading

classitems.description: get all descendants of the layers. Optionally the layers can be filtered by an array filter function.
classitems.name: getLayerDescendants

params.name: filter
params.description: An array filter function that is applied to each layer object of the scene. Should return true or false.

return.description: result returns the layer found by id or null

classitems.description: get Objects by a evaluation function which recursively tries to match the objects of the scene

classitems.description: inherited from THREE.EventDispatcher

params.description: function, to be removed from the event

classitems.description: inherited from THREE.EventDispatcher
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: listener
params.description: function, to be removed from the event

classitems.description: inherited from THREE.EventDispatcher
classitems.name: dispatchEvent

classitems.description: Sets the face culling mode for an object
classitems.name: setFaceCulling

classitems.description: Sets the vertex color mode for an object
classitems.name: setVertexColors

classitems.description: Merges object properties from a abse object with properties of an extending object.
classitems.name: mergeObjects

return.description: merged object with base properties extended/overwritten by extending object.

classitems.description: Transforms absolute screencoordinates from DOMEvents to relative screencoordinates inside a DOMElement
classitems.name: getRelativeScreenCoordsFromDOMEvent

params.name: domElement
params.description: Usually the canvas Element

params.name: event
params.description: e.g. a mouse event

return.description: A Vector which contains the event coordinates transformed into coordinates relative to the upper left corner of the DOMElement

classitems.description: Transforms screencoordinates from DOMEvents
classitems.name: getViewportCoordsFromDOMEvent

params.name: domElement
params.description: Usually the canvas Element

params.name: event
params.description: e.g. a mouse event

return.description: A Vector which contains the event coordinates transformed into viewport coordinates (x and y are between -1 and 1)

classitems.description: Transforms relative screen coordinates (e.g.from a canvas element) to normalized viewport coordinates
classitems.name: transformRelativeScreenCoordsToViewportCoords

return.description: A Vector which contains the relative screen coordinates transformed into viewport coordinates (x and y are between -1 and 1)

classitems.description: Transforms viewport coordinates to relative screen coordinates (e.g.from a canvas element)
classitems.name: transformViewportCoordsToRelativeScreenCoords

return.description: A Vector which contains the viewport coordinates transformed into relative screen coordinates (x and y are between width and height)

classitems.description: Recursively computes the bounding box of a scenegraph
classitems.name: computeBoundingBoxRecursive

return.description: The united bounding box of the node and all its descendants

classitems.name: computeVertexMeanRecursive

params.name: node
params.description: node from which mean will be computed recursively including itself

return.description: the point which represents the computed mean

todo: does NOT take care of MatrixRotations

classitems.description: Performs a rotation of a point around a center
classitems.name: polarTransformationAddAngle

params.name: center
params.description: center of rotation

params.name: point
params.description: point to rotate around center

params.name: deltaTheta
params.description: horizontal angle in degrees to be rotated

params.name: deltaPhi
params.description: vertical angle in degrees to be rotated

classitems.description:
sets the position property of an object to its boundingBoxCenter
and changes vertex coordinates accordingly
classitems.name: translatePositionToBBoxCenter

classitems.description:
function to sort objects by object.renderDepth property.
Calculates distance from camera to object.position and subtracts the boundingSphere.radius.
Helps to obtain a better sorting of small objects inside bigger ones.
classitems.name: calcRenderDepthMinusBSphereRadius

classitems.description: function to calculate parameter for orthographic cameras based on params from a perspective camera and a distance at which the visible size of an object should be maintained
classitems.name: getOrthoParamsFromPerspectiveCam

classitems.description: function to calculate the size parameters for an orthographic camera
classitems.name: getOrthoSizeFromFovDistanceAspect

params.name: fov
params.description: in degrees

params.name: distance
params.description: at which size is to be computed according to fov

params.name: aspect
params.description: ratio of canvas with / height

return.description: orthosize Object which contains (top, bottom, left, right)-values for orthographic Cameras

classitems.description: function to calculate the distance a perspective camera needs from a target to maintain the visual size of objects
classitems.name: getPerspectiveDistanceFromFovHalfHeight

params.name: fov
params.description: field of view in degrees

params.name: halfHeight
params.description: half of the orthographic camera height or height at distance to be visible in camera in scene units

return.description: distance a perspective camera with the given field of view (fov) should be placed from a target to completly see the given (half-)height

classitems.description: check for item in array
classitems.name: arrayContains

params.name: item
params.description: item to check for in array

classitems.description: Removes duplicates from an array, even different objects with equal properties
classitems.name: removeDuplicatesFromArray

classitems.description:
Flatten 3D Vectors horizontally to 2D
Removes y from vector3 and puts z as y of vector2.
classitems.name: vector3ToVector2

classitems.description: Transform a Vector2 to Vector3 by adding a y component
classitems.name: vector2ToVector3

params.name: v2
params.description: represents horizontal points

params.name: y
params.description: height to add to horizontal point

classitems.description: Delete an object properly
classitems.name: disposeObject

params.name: object
params.description: the object to be disposed

params.name: deleteGeometry
params.description: should the geometry of the object be disposed

params.name: deleteMaterial
params.description: should the material of the object be disposed also? Set to false if material is shared by other objects

params.name: deleteTextures
params.description: should the textures of the object be disposed also? Set to false if textures are shared by other objects

params.name: recursive
params.description: should all descendants of the object be disposed by the same criteria aswell?

classitems.description: isTypeOrClass
classitems.name: isTypeOrClass

classitems.description: get Objects by recursively calling a callback function which should return true or false to all children
classitems.name: getObjectsBy

params.name: array
params.description: array to be filled with descendands or a new one will be created

return.description: either the passed in array or a new one

classitems.description: The Path to where this file is stored
classitems.name: LIBRARYPATH

classitems.description: Constants for setting bitmask flags on working material to indicate that it is still in use by some control
classitems.name: WORKINGMATERIALFLAGS
example:
WORKINGMATERIALFLAGS:{
				SELECT:1,	//material is highlighted by GIScene.Control.Select
				WIRE:2,		//wireframe state has been changed
				SHADING:4,	//shading mode ( smooth | flat ) has been changed
				SIDE:8,		//face culling has been changed ( front | back | double )
				MAP:16,		//texture has been turned off
				OPACITY:32, //opacity value has been changed
				VERTEXCOLORS:64, //vertexColors ( noColors | faceColors | vertexColors )
				DIFFUSE:128, //diffuseColor ( THREE.Color )
				AMBIENT:256 //ambientColor ( THREE.Color )
			}

classitems.description: For internal use only.
classitems.name: idCounter

classitems.description: The relative path from the script folder (where GIScene_x.x.x.js is stored) to the "resources" folder
classitems.name: RESOURCESPATH
